candidates.title: Modify FFI client methods to avoid task spawning
candidates.body:
FFI client methods now use `try_send` on the async channel, and immediately return an error if there is insufficient capacity to enqueue a request.

This is a proposed fix to https://github.com/stepfunc/rodbus/issues/135

Also: 

1) Update dependencies and fix the CI that broke due to Github action/runner changes.
2) Add build and FFI packaging for `aarch64-apple-darwn`.

candidates.title: Share TLS configuration
candidates.body: Share common TLS verifier/PEM code with DNP3 from util crates.

candidates.title: Runtime shutdown with optional timeout
candidates.body:
External: Adds the ability to shut down the runtime with an optional timeout.

Internal: Refactoring to support new versions of oo-bindgen and drop-safe promises.

candidates.title: Use 100% dependencies from crates.io
candidates.body: This will allow publishing of the core `rodbus` crate onto crates.io as well.

candidates.title: Add MUSL .SO targets
candidates.body:
- Adds MUSL Linux targets to the CI for x64, ARM64, and ARMv6.
- Migrate to `oo_bindgen` 0.5.0 which packages C/C++ distributions using a single ZIP.
- Modify CI to select packaged libs for each language using a config file

candidates.title: Enable full LTO for release builds
candidates.body: There doesn't appear to be any downsides other than build time. Resulting library and perf binary are smaller and performance tests show a speedup on Windows/Linux.

candidates.title: Externalize tokio-ffi oo_bindgen model and implementation
candidates.body: This allows sharing the oo_bindgen model for Tokio with other protocols, i.e. DNP3

candidates.title: Externalize tracing-ffi-schema
candidates.body: Moves the shared FFI model for tracing to an external crate.

candidates.title: Use common (de)serialization routines with DNP3 via external crate
candidates.body: Use [scursor](https://github.com/stepfunc/scursor) read and write cursors to share code with DNP3.

candidates.title: Fault-tolerant RTU server
candidates.body:
The RTU server now opens the port on the Tokio task. It will retry at a configurable rate. If the port fails while running, it will retry to open the port after the delay.

This change was motivated by the fact that people use USB dongles that can be added/removed at will.

candidates.title: refactor CI bom/licenses
candidates.body: Refactor how licenses/bom works as well

candidates.title: make tokio-serial an optional dependency for the core crate
candidates.body:
Makes serial optional in rodbus in addition to TLS.

Makes serial and TLS optional when compiling the FFI and JNI libraries.

candidates.title: Remove tokio-test
candidates.body: Removes the weird re-exporting previously required by `tokio-mock`. Instead, depend on `tokio` directly and use `tokio_test::` macro to run most tests on a real runtime.  Create an external crate called `tokio-mock-io` that doesn't have the problems that the ones in `tokio-test` have.

candidates.title: Client read while Idle
candidates.body:
Fixes https://github.com/stepfunc/rodbus/issues/70

Also improves/consolidates the logging when client/server sessions are closed.

candidates.title: Refactor/new jni gen
candidates.body: Changes how the JNI library is built, allowing x64 and ARM64 to be built in the cross matrix.

candidates.title: Add feature flag for TLS support.
RTU support
candidates.body:
- [x] Serial/RTU support
- [x] Broadcast support for the server
- [x] Bindings
- [x] Documentation

chosen_pr.title: Externalize tokio-ffi oo_bindgen model and implementation
chosen_pr.body: This allows sharing the oo_bindgen model for Tokio with other protocols, i.e. DNP3

chosen_detail.title: Externalize tokio-ffi oo_bindgen model and implementation
